page.title: 11Living in Beckenham
page.content: Where I used to live there was a lot of lovely countryside.When we came here I thought I would hate the rush and noise of the big city, but over the years I have got used to the traffic. I would prefer to live in Barry in Wales, but you can't have everything. The things I miss are good clubs and acti- vities. In Barry there was always some- thing to join. When I speak to my grand parents on the phone they keep telling me off for losing my Welsh accent. We now have a much better house with double glazing and central heating which we never dreamed of having be- fore. My Dad has a much better paid job and it is much more stable. The school I now go to, Marian Vian, is much more modern with a large field,a large play- ground and an outdoor pool. Beckenham is a nice area to live in. Dawn Hopkins, Marian Vian
